DOC.HEAD: Rain From Texas to Mid-Atlantic Coast, Snow Further North
DOC.TEXT: Rain fell from Texas to the Middle Atlantic coast Saturday while freezing rain and snow stretched further north from New England to the Plains and parts of the Rockies. A flash flood watch was posted over a portion of east-central Texas. Almost 4 inches of rain fell overnight at Broaddus, and rain continued to fall Saturday morning. Nearly an inch of rain fell at Monroe, La., in the six hours ended at 1 p.m. EST, while two-thirds of an inch and more fell at Little Rock and Jonesboro, Ark. Flash flood watches also were posted through the night for Kentucky and much of West Virginia. Snowfall amounts were modest in most places, although Hartford, Conn., and parts of northern Pennsylvania received about 4 inches overnight and up to 5 inches fell Saturday morning near New Mexico's Red River. A winter storm watch was posted into Sunday for the Texas Big Bend region. Late in the morning, snow was falling in central and southern New England, southeast New York state, northwest Iowa, western Wisconsin, much of Minnesota, eastern North Dakota, eastern and central South Dakota, south-central Kansas, southeast Colorado, southern Wyoming and north-central Utah. Freezing rain, often mixed with snow, fell in parts of Pennsylvania, northern Illinois, southeast Wisconsin, southern Minnesota, Iowa, northwest Missouri, eastern and north-central Kansas, eastern Nebraska and northwest Texas. Rain was falling in north-central Texas, northern Alabama, northern Georgia, western South Carolina, northern North Carolina, Virginia, Delaware, Maryland, New Jersey, West Virginia, Kentucky, northwest Indiana, the rest of Illinois and southeast Missouri. Rain and occasional thunderstorms were scattered over Arkansas, western Mississippi, northern Louisiana and east-central Texas. Caribou, Maine, had its coldest December reading on record with an early morning low of 31 degrees below zero. That shattered the old record of 26 below in 1975. Bakersfield, Calif., had a morning low of 28 degrees. It was the 18th day this month with a low below the freezing point, exceeding the previous record of 13 December days with freezing temperatures in 1949. The low temperature for the Lower 48 states Saturday morning was 34 degrees below zero at Houlton, Maine. Temperatures at 3 p.m. EST ranged from 2 degrees at Massena, N.Y., to 81 degrees at Fort Myers, Fla.
